Weather Wisdom Blog

Rain, snow to continue

Light rain and snow showers are continuing across the region and colder air will filter into the area later, meteorologist Dave Epstein writes. Forecast (12:02 p.m.)
  • Western, Central Mass. get pounded with snow
  • Video Our latest weather forecast | Storm tweets

Ex-Boston Mayor Ray Flynn backs
Brown on 'conscience exemption'

The Democrat is applauding Republican Scott Brown for calling for a "conscience exemption" from the president's policy on birth control coverage. (Globe, 11:59 a.m.)
Cheap Eats | Affordable local dining

South Boston's new Paramount hits spot

This casual, affordable spot on East Broadway stays true to its original namesake on Beacon Hill.
  • Globe reviews the new Paramount | Dining Out reviews
Pictures | Notable deaths of 2012

Conservative publisher Breitbart dies

Activist Andrew Breitbart, who was behind the investigations that led to the resignations of Rep. Anthony Weiner and Agriculture Department official Shirley Sherrod, has died at the age of 43. (1/9/12)
  • Story: Publisher Andrew Breitbart dies in LA | Guest Book

Interim director of Harvard primate lab resigns following latest monkey death

Dr. Fred Wang, interim head of the New England Primate Research Center, resigned following the fourth monkey death in less than two years. (Globe, 10:51 a.m.)

Hamilton police mourn death of officer

During nearly two decades, Kenneth Nagy earned a reputation as a respected police officer in Hamilton. But last Friday, Nagy's life ended in desperate violence and left two communities searching for answers. (Boston Globe)

Ryan Harris’ case is the latest example of prosecutors levying federal charges against a defendant for helping others access information on the Internet.

News

Pre-dawn storms turn deadly

Overnight storms raked the nation's midsection, killing at least 12 people in three states. At least 16 tornadoes were reported from Nebraska, Kansas, Missouri, Illinois, and Kentucky.

Politics

Romney wins non-binding Wyoming caucuses

Mitt Romney has won the non-binding presidential caucuses in Wyoming – held in each county between Feb. 9 and Feb. 29 – beating Rick Santorum by seven points.

Business

A look at Google's privacy policy

Google has begun integrating all the information it collects about users into a single privacy policy. This is raising concerns among privacy advocates and shrugs from people who prefer the convenience over their personal data.
